caption: Interesting place, didn’t expect it open and discover but it happened and I’m happy to share my experience there as well as atmosphere and combination of something old and new modern, discovered a lot about card production and how they used to be made and saw a lot of designs! And for young people this place is free! Absolutely worth to go! Thanks

Excellent! Museum in 3 parts,Magic,2, history of playing+tarot cards.3, History of the town.photos,paintings.Everything written in French but theres Google translate.Staff could speak English.Apprecited.They were friendly and helpful .

A nice museum of playing cards located in Issy-les-Moulineaux. It is open only from Wednesdays to Sundays.  Admission fee: Adult 4,7€ , under 26 free.  The museum was established in 1986 base on the collecton of Louis Chardonneret (1849-1935) and Robert Thissen, since 1997 has occupied its current location in the former Château d'Issy of the Princes of Conti.  It contains about 9000 objects, including nearly 6500 playing cards, 980 etchings, drawings, and posters, and more than other 1000 objects related to card games.  It also presents temporary exhibitions.  Other galleries tell the story of Issy-les-Moulineaux and the castle of the Princes of Conti, the beginnings of aviation, and noted artists associated with Issy (Auguste Rodin, Henri Matisse, and Jean Dubuffet).  The museum won the 1999 European Museum of the Year Award.
A well organised museum with interesting histories about cards.

Very bad experience, chaotic organization and rude customer service.  We booked the escape game experience for today (a month ago!) via phone. Today, we got to the place on time, and they told us to wait before starting. After waiting for 30 minutes, we asked again and, to our surprise, they told us we don't have any reservation in a very rude way, no apology, no nothing. I give them 1 star for the way they treat customers, the way they wasted our time, and their inefficient booking process. All in all, a lot to improve.

Great museum if you're into playing cards as I am.  Only quibble is that the exhibits are shown only with French explanations, I know we're in Paris but would have thought a nod might be given to international visitors. It was beautifully presented though and even the music playing in the background was spot on.
Very interesting museum. There were so many cards from playing cards to Tarots cards and the evolution of cards from centuries. As per pre casino worker, it was amazing.
Very nice meseum displays lots of playing cards including the ones from Asia. Modern design of the building and located not far from Mairie d'Issy metro station.
A very nice place to visit all cards from around the world. They also have temporary exhibitions which are nice. The place is awesome. A must go
Nice, small and very well setup museum. Going through history of playing cards.

Booked a table at the Japanese pop up restaurant. That was by far the worst restaurant experience in my life. Ordered the food and was told 30 minutes later that they had run out of some food as well as drinks. All the food just heated in the microwave.  Avoid like the pest.
A small but nice museum where you can find the history of cards, seeing it's variations through history. Also free in the first Sunday of every month.
The only museum on playing cards in France. Has a great ongoing exhibition on Indian playing cards from Orissa called the Ganjifa.
An unusual but always interesting and highly specialised museum that often hosts exhibitions
Those fascinated by tarot cards and their history will find this place fantastic!
Not to be missed, a real treat
Amazing collection!
Super

Very beautiful museum in Ile de France 😀I enjoyed discovering it. Spending almost three hours there, I was immersed in the world of cards and their stories for years. Each piece was accompanied by detailed information. I recommend it to anyone looking for a cultural adventure.
The opposite of a museum: evolving, connected to its time. The Magic exhibition is astonishing in its simplicity and originality. A magician introduces the exhibition with humor and virtuosity.

The Playing Card Museum is a little wonder to discover! Located in Issy les Moulineaux, this museum offers a unique and fascinating experience on the world of playing cards, from their history to their creation.  The exhibits are varied and very well presented, with an impressive collection of card games from around the world. I particularly appreciated the explanatory panels which give an interesting overview of the evolution of maps and their cultural impact through the ages.  The atmosphere is pleasant and calm, which allows you to really enjoy each exhibition. The staff is also very friendly and passionate, willing to share stories and information about the different cards.

Very warm welcome, the exhibitions on Pokémon and tarot cards are very well done, including for children. You will find real wonders. We also enjoyed the historical part of the city, especially the parts concerning the rise of aviation and the industrial era. The period building is truly magnificent. The only small downside for me is the modern exterior architecture of the museum which I find ugly.

Beautiful exhibition "Constant Pape", and great discovery of the work of this impressionist painter 🎨 We liked it. On this occasion, we discovered the playing card museum and saw the history and metamorphosis of Issy les Mx. To see 😉

Very nice museum showcasing a fairly rare collection (there are only 7 playing card museums in the world). I highly recommend the guided tour. There is also the museum, a part which traces the history of the city and a space for temporary exhibitions.

I came for the temporary Pokémon and company exhibition which was frankly not fun, but I was seduced by their permanent collection. I spent hours admiring their cards, the subdued atmosphere invites you to stroll around and take your time. Exceptional, very well presented pieces suitable for all types of audiences. Amateurs, curious people, enthusiasts, young and old will find what they are looking for. Bridges are made with history, politics, graphic arts, customs and traditions. Very rich, super interesting, I highly recommend.

Very nice museum. We enjoyed discovering it. For people who have difficulty remaining in a standing position for a long time, there are seats available in the rooms allowing them to move at their own pace and rest a little. The layout allows us to appreciate the importance of the game and its supports based on events, notably the end of the monarchy. Evolution over the years to arrive at our century that I did not suspect. Very personally enriching moment. We will come back to visit it in its entirety.

Very beautiful playing card museum, temporary Pokémon exhibition with superb cards, Magic cards and their detailed history. We learn a lot about the history of these game cards. There are lots of different types of card games, world cards, unusual ones... The children also find a certain interest in them, they were happy.

Little known, this museum which presents playing cards and magic and which also offers activities is definitely worth the detour The welcome is warm whether at reception or in the dining room, and the staff answers all questions. Great success!
A beautiful place that combines two museums: that of playing cards and that of the town of Issy les Moulineaux. I advise you to take the guided tour. It provides a real plus for better understanding.

I basically came to this museum for the temporary exhibition on Pokemon and other card games. There were 4 levels. The ground floor includes reception for purchasing tickets and a shop (this one also sold sun and moon boosters - 5 year old ultra prism for 8 euros each!). Full price entry for non-Isseans is 5.4 euros. Free for under 26s. The two underground levels contain the permanent museum. The whole thing is modern and rather classy. These basements exhibit the evolution of classic card games through time and cultures. There you can find tarot, Italian games, games from other more distant countries and of course the classic 52 card games. I learned lots of things there and loved it even though it's not necessarily my thing. So much so that I went to look at my decks of cards when I got home to check everything I learned at the museum. I won't look at card games the same way now and will know how to appreciate them. Finally, the upper level is dedicated to the temporary exhibition on Pokémon / magic / yu gi oh cards. Not much on the Yu-Gi-Oh side. On the magic side, quite extensive with an Arabian Night set, alpha and beta cards, banned cards including a Black Lotus, and cards drawn in very few copies (hundreds). Really nice! On the pokemon side it's beautiful and colorful, there is a complete basic set but the flagship cards are a little damaged, then a few other cards including among the most interesting, an aquali ex from gen 3, a voltali star, a pre release ptera fossil and some holo wizards. In short, a very good outing, thank you!
Original museum! The collection is vast and very extensive. There may be a missing guideline in the signage, we don't really understand the route of the exhibition.

Good general presentation on magic until the magician uses a live mouse during the show! Perhaps in 2025 it would be a good idea to stop using animals as accessories or for our entertainment! Very disappointed with the lack of values ​​and ethics of this museum, I will not come back!

Very good museum, currently offering an exhibition on the history of tcg, from Magic to yugioh and pokemon. I find that this exhibition is very focused on Magic the Gathering rather than the other two games. On the other hand, the very very large permanent exhibition is breathtaking!

Museum night with a great exhibition on Pokémon cards. Our kids loved it! Presentation of Cosplay with 6 top cosplayers, very kind and smiling 😊👍🏻 The staff were lovely. The museum is on several levels, it is a beautiful place. We had a great evening 👌🏻❤️
Welcome 😄 Superb collection of playing cards and divination cards in a small, unique and original museum to absolutely discover with precise information on sliding panels...

A very nice museum, it’s a shame that the receptionist is so unpleasant and so uninvolved. Incomprehension of the price, indicated reduced for Isseens / GPSO, and not applied because only for seniors. However, this is not specified anywhere and the person at reception sends you off saying that it is not she who displays the prices. What a shame the visit was ruined by such bad vibes.

We see that there is a real joy in welcoming visitors. I visited the Pokémon/Magic/Yu-Gi-Oh exhibition and the permanent exhibition. There are some wonderful playing cards. In the permanent exhibition, pay attention to the fact that there is a button under each card display case which allows you to slide the 1st display case to reveal a 2nd card display case. On the other hand, I would have liked to learn more about the history of the card game, tarot cards, etc.

Very good museum, educational, interactive, suitable for all generations. I came for the magnificent exhibition of illuminated tarot cards and then ended up visiting the entire museum. It was a pleasant surprise, the atmosphere is very peaceful because the museum is not very busy, the collections are beautiful and well explained.  Only negative point, the shop is very poor, impossible to find a pretty card or a souvenir of this wonderful visit.
